tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 263 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost aggressive creatures like Goblin Bushwhacker and Voldaren Epicure to deal damage early on. Clockwork Percussionist and Goblin Tomb Raider help generate additional resources, while burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Galvanic Blast, and Fireblast provide direct damage to finish off opponents. Experimental Synthesizer provides extra utility, and Wrenn's Resolve and Rally at the Hornburg help maintain board presence and push for the win. The mana base is optimized for fast play with Great Furnace and Mountains.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies that rely on sacrificing, removal, and resource generation. By utilizing low-cost creatures and artifacts, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of damage and disruption. The deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal and graveyard hate. With a mix of creature beats and burn spells, this deck can deliver consistent pressure and close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Persistent Petitioners to assemble a large milling engine while also benefiting from their ability to tap for effects. The deck includes various creatures and spells that help fuel the mill strategy and generate card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Generous Ent and Gnaw to the Bone provide ways to stabilize and gain life, while Lead the Stampede helps to refill the board with creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of mill effects and creature pressure.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, utilizing low-cost creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker to deal damage quickly. It also includes removal and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper to control the board and finish off opponents. Faithless Looting helps with card advantage and enables graveyard synergies with cards like Black Mage's Rod and Alms of the Vein. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of direct damage, creature pressure, and graveyard recursion to secure a quick victory.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Balustrade Spy combo to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures and trigger effects that benefit from having a large number of creatures in the graveyard. The deck focuses on ramping up with mana-producing creatures like Llanowar Elves and Priest of Titania, while also utilizing cards like Conjurer's Bauble and Winding Way to dig through the deck and find key combo pieces. The ultimate goal is to quickly fill the board with creatures and use Dread Return to bring back a powerful finisher like Lotleth Giant for a game-winning attack.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategies through counterspells, removal spells, and creature bounce effects. The deck focuses on card advantage and tempo plays by utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Faerie Miscreant, along with card filtering spells like Brainstorm and Preordain. The deck aims to maintain control of the game by consistently answering threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately outlasting them with powerful late-game threats like Thorn of the Black Rose and Ninja of the Deep Hours.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with low-cost creatures like Voldaren Epicure, Sneaky Snacker, and Kitchen Imp, while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to remove threats and push through damage. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Fiery Temper and Demand Answers to control the pace of the game. With a mix of aggressive creatures, removal spells, and hand disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while staying ahead on card advantage. The deck includes a variety of control tools such as Counterspell, Snuff Out, and Cast Down, as well as card draw options like Brainstorm and LÃ³rien Revealed. In addition, it features creatures like Augur of Bolas and Murmuring Mystic to provide additional value and pressure. The mana base supports the deck's goals with a mix of lands that produce both blue and black mana.

This deck is focused on aggressive gameplay, utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Myr Enforcer and Gingerbrute to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt to deal direct damage and remove blockers. The deck benefits from the artifact synergy provided by cards like Clockwork Percussionist and Goblin Tomb Raider, allowing for explosive starts and strong board presence. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells, with a mix of lands to ensure smooth gameplay.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a single creature with powerful auras to create a fast and aggressive threat. The key strategy is to play low-cost hexproof creatures like Slippery Bogle and Gladecover Scout and then load them up with auras such as Ethereal Armor, Ancestral Mask, and Armadillo Cloak. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a highly buffed-up creature that they have difficulty removing. The deck also includes ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Abundant Growth to ensure a smooth mana curve.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Balustrade Spy and Dread Return to mill your entire library and return a powerful creature like Lotleth Giant to the battlefield to deal lethal damage to your opponent. The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with creatures like Overgrown Battlement and Saruli Caretaker, while also utilizing cards like Winding Way and Lead the Stampede to find your combo pieces efficiently. Additionally, the deck includes disruption with creatures like Mesmeric Fiend and Masked Vandal to disrupt your opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifact creatures onto the battlefield and using spells like Galvanic Blast, Reckoner's Bargain, and Metallic Rebuke to deal damage and control the opponent's board. It also utilizes card draw cards like Thoughtcast and Refurbished Familiar to maintain card advantage. The deck takes advantage of the synergy between artifacts and cards like Ichor Wellspring to generate mana and fuel powerful spells. The mix of creatures, burn spells, and control elements allows the deck to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, dealing damage consistently and efficiently. The deck aims to build up a board presence quickly and finish off the opponent with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast. By combining creatures that can deal damage upon entering the battlefield with low-cost spells that deal damage directly to the opponent, this deck is designed to pressure the opponent and force them to react quickly to avoid being overwhelmed.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent with efficient and low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent. The deck also includes numerous card draw and counter spells to maintain control over the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of countermagic and tempo spells such as Consider and Thought Scour allows for versatile gameplay and the ability to protect your creatures while pushing for damage. Additionally, the deck includes a few finishers like Tolarian Terror and LÃ³rien Revealed to secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelming opponents with low-cost, evasive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game. Using efficient card draw and counterspells, it aims to maintain tempo while putting pressure on the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Thought Scour and Cryptic Serpent allows for a synergy that enables the deck to refill its hand and cast large threats for cheap. The key strategy is to outpace the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient removal, leading to a swift victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble a board full of aggressive creatures and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent with direct damage and efficient creature attacks. Utilizing Rakdos colored cards, the deck aims to take advantage of cheap creatures and removal spells to maintain pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their strategy. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage and lifegain to help maintain a strong tempo throughout the game.
